trans-unit.source: Internal Load balancer Overview
trans-unit.target: Internal Load balancer Overview

trans-unit.source: Internal Load Balancer (ILB) is a security enhancement over the current Internet facing load balancer that is offered in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Internal Load Balancer (ILB) is a security enhancement over the current Internet facing load balancer that is offered in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Access to the ILB can only be done by resources inside the cloud service or using VPN to access the Azure infrastructure to reach the ILB.
trans-unit.target: Access to the ILB can only be done by resources inside the cloud service or using VPN to access the Azure infrastructure to reach the ILB.

trans-unit.source: The infrastructure restricts the accessibility and creates a trust boundary between the load balanced virtual IP addresses to a Cloud Service or a Virtual Network and will never be exposed to a Internet endpoint directly.
trans-unit.target: The infrastructure restricts the accessibility and creates a trust boundary between the load balanced virtual IP addresses to a Cloud Service or a Virtual Network and will never be exposed to a Internet endpoint directly.

trans-unit.source: This enables internal Line of Business applications to run in Azure and be accessed within the cloud or from on-premises.
trans-unit.target: This enables internal Line of Business applications to run in Azure and be accessed within the cloud or from on-premises.

trans-unit.source: Scenarios for Internal load balancer
trans-unit.target: Scenarios for Internal load balancer

trans-unit.source: You can use ILB in many new configurations, including the following:
trans-unit.target: You can use ILB in many new configurations, including the following:

trans-unit.source: Azure Internal Load Balancing (ILB) provides load balancing between virtual machines that reside inside of a cloud service or a virtual network with a regional scope.
trans-unit.target: Azure Internal Load Balancing (ILB) provides load balancing between virtual machines that reside inside of a cloud service or a virtual network with a regional scope.

trans-unit.source: For information about the use and configuration of virtual networks with a regional scope, see [Regional Virtual Networks](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/05/14/regional-virtual-networks/) in the Azure blog.
trans-unit.target: For information about the use and configuration of virtual networks with a regional scope, see [Regional Virtual Networks](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/05/14/regional-virtual-networks/) in the Azure blog.

trans-unit.source: Existing virtual networks that have been configured for an affinity group cannot use ILB.
trans-unit.target: Existing virtual networks that have been configured for an affinity group cannot use ILB.

trans-unit.source: ILB enables the following new types of load balancing:
trans-unit.target: ILB enables the following new types of load balancing:

trans-unit.source: Within a cloud service, from virtual machines to a set of virtual machines that reside within the same cloud service (see Figure 1).
trans-unit.target: Within a cloud service, from virtual machines to a set of virtual machines that reside within the same cloud service (see Figure 1).

trans-unit.source: Within a virtual network, from virtual machines in the virtual network to a set of virtual machines that reside within the same cloud service of the virtual network (see Figure 2).
trans-unit.target: Within a virtual network, from virtual machines in the virtual network to a set of virtual machines that reside within the same cloud service of the virtual network (see Figure 2).

trans-unit.source: For a cross-premises virtual network, from on-premises computers to a set of virtual machines that reside within the same cloud service of the virtual network (see Figure 3).
trans-unit.target: For a cross-premises virtual network, from on-premises computers to a set of virtual machines that reside within the same cloud service of the virtual network (see Figure 3).

trans-unit.source: The existing Azure load balancing only provides load balancing between Internet-based computers and virtual machines in a cloud service.
trans-unit.target: The existing Azure load balancing only provides load balancing between Internet-based computers and virtual machines in a cloud service.

trans-unit.source: ILB enables new capabilities for hosting virtual machines in Azure.
trans-unit.target: ILB enables new capabilities for hosting virtual machines in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Internet-facing, multi-tier applications in which the back-end tiers are not Internet-facing but require load balancing for traffic from the Internet-facing tier.
trans-unit.target: Internet-facing, multi-tier applications in which the back-end tiers are not Internet-facing but require load balancing for traffic from the Internet-facing tier.

trans-unit.source: Load balancing for line-of-business (LOB) applications hosted in Azure without requiring additional load balancer hardware or software.
trans-unit.target: Load balancing for line-of-business (LOB) applications hosted in Azure without requiring additional load balancer hardware or software.

trans-unit.source: Including on-premises servers in the set of computers whose traffic is load balanced.
trans-unit.target: Including on-premises servers in the set of computers whose traffic is load balanced.

trans-unit.source: The following sections describe these configurations in more detail.
trans-unit.target: The following sections describe these configurations in more detail.

trans-unit.source: Internet facing multi-tier applications
trans-unit.target: Internet facing multi-tier applications

trans-unit.source: The web tier has Internet facing endpoints for Internet clients and is part of a load-balanced set.
trans-unit.target: The web tier has Internet facing endpoints for Internet clients and is part of a load-balanced set.

trans-unit.source: The load balancer distributes incoming traffic from web clients for TCP port 443 (HTTPS) to the web servers.
trans-unit.target: The load balancer distributes incoming traffic from web clients for TCP port 443 (HTTPS) to the web servers.

trans-unit.source: The database servers are behind an ILB endpoint which the web servers use for storage.
trans-unit.target: The database servers are behind an ILB endpoint which the web servers use for storage.

trans-unit.source: This database service load balanced endpoint, which traffic is load balanced across the database servers in the ILB set.
trans-unit.target: This database service load balanced endpoint, which traffic is load balanced across the database servers in the ILB set.

trans-unit.source: Intranet Line of business (LOB) applications
trans-unit.target: Intranet Line of business (LOB) applications

trans-unit.source: Traffic from clients on the on-premises network get load-balanced across the set of LOB servers using VPN connection to Azure network.
trans-unit.target: Traffic from clients on the on-premises network get load-balanced across the set of LOB servers using VPN connection to Azure network.

trans-unit.source: The client machine will have access to an IP address from Azure VPN service using point to site VPN .It will allow to use the LOB application hosted behind the ILB endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The client machine will have access to an IP address from Azure VPN service using point to site VPN .It will allow to use the LOB application hosted behind the ILB endpoint.

trans-unit.target: Internal load balancing using point to site VPN

trans-unit.source: Another scenario for the LOB is to have a site to site VPN to the virtual network where the ILB endpoint is configured.This will allow on-premises network traffic to be routed to the ILB endpoint.
